headerText: The `v-scroll` directive allows you to provide callbacks when the window or a specifically defined element are scrolled.

usage.desc: The default behavior is to bind to the window. If no additional configuration options are needed, you can simply pass your callback function.

options.desc: For a more fine tuned approach, you can designate the target to bind the scroll event listener.

options.arg:target: `v-scroll:#target="callback"` The target watched for scroll changes. Defaults to window but can be changed to any valid id selector.
options.value: `v-scroll="callback"` The function to invoke on target scroll
